body:
Maybe I'm misunderstanding this, but the output seems to be there under the output tab on the left. What kind of output are you expecting? 

![Annotation 2019-07-04 180908](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9168908/60688978-d8b41e80-9e86-11e9-8aff-02467ac759fa.png)

Sorry, I'm talking about text output on the progress of the model. Ludwig is not printing any text to standard output.

![AwesomeScreenshot-ludwig-testing-Kaggle-2019-07-05-08-07-29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/620050/60720779-33d72700-9f02-11e9-9870-49b6834aa5b4.png)
There were some recent fixes with logging applied to ludwig master that haven't been released yet. You might want to try running from master, or wait until the next release.

I already installed it from master:

`pip install git+https://github.com/uber/ludwig`

But still with same problem.
@leokury looking into it. In the meantime, use the CLI tool if possible.

@leokury your issue will be fixed once this [pr](https://github.com/uber/ludwig/pull/412) is merged. 

Also, Ludwig's API by default only prints errors. So if you want more information, you'll have to modify your code to set the logging level, like this: 

model = LudwigModel(model_definition, logging_level=logging.DEBUG)
train_stats = model.train(train_df.head(10), logging_level=logging.DEBUG)
Merged the PR, @eokury can you please confirm it works now?

I confirm that using the latest version of the master and including the logging DEBUG text output is printed.

Thanks guys!

Just one question, by default should ludwig not print the model's progress? When I used it on my local machine ludwig was printing the progress, even without using DEBUG logging. It would be interesting to standardize or document it.
@leokury Thanks for confirming. We'll update the documentation. The logging levels are set differently for the CLI and the API.

issue.title: De-duplicate logging statements and logging formatting errors, caused by legacy workaround for tensorflow
issue.body:
Remove tensorflow's [workaround for collision with built in python logging](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/26691), integrated into ludwig via #413. This workaround is not needed for Torch, and actually causes duplicate logging.

Also, clean up and repartition logging statements. Example of new output:

issue.title: Clean up `logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)`
issue.body:
There are vestiges of a [mechanism that was introduced to Ludwig](https://github.com/ludwig-ai/ludwig/issues/413) to workaround an issue with [tensorflow's logging](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/26691):

```python
import logging

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

...

logger.info()
```

In torch, these should be able to be replaced with out-of-the-box logging:

```python
import logging

logging.info()
```
